page.title: 13EDUCATION Cont.
page.content: for closure due to falling rolls. Fortunately a large housing estate was built at Hatt (outside our block) and the children from Hatt Village were zoned to Landulph School. During 1983 virtually a new school was built using the old building as an assembly hall, gym and dining area. The new buildings consisted of 3 purpose-built classrooms, workspace, library, indoor cloakrooms and toilets, and kitchen. A sports field was also purchased from the Duchy of Cornwall. Present numbers in the school fluctuate between 75 and 90. The children on leaving school go on to secondary education at Saltash or Callington Comprehensives, or private education.
